docs.lead_paragraph: An increase of 4.4 percent is the smallest in 48 years as the recession throttled back the growth of health costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Test strips for diabetes patients can be costly and prevent few of the disease’s complications, a Canadian analysis found.

headline.seo: Blood Sugar Monitoring Not So Beneficial, Canadian Study Finds

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democratic leaders will meet on Tuesday to begin discussing plans to merge their version of major health care legislation with the bill adopted by the Senate on Christmas Eve. But leadership aides in both chambers say there are no plans for a formal conference committee to reconcile the two measures. The Senate passed its bill on a party-line vote, 60 to 39, and the Republican leader, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky, promised that he and his caucus would do everything in their power to stop it from becoming law.
docs.abstract: House Democratic leaders will begin discussing plans to merge their version of health care legislation with bill adopted by Senate; there are no current plans for formal conference committee to reconcile measures; Democrats are preparing strategy that will make it difficult for Republicans to filibuster (M)
docs.snippet: House Democratic leaders will meet on Tuesday to begin discussing plans to merge their version of major health care legislation with the bill adopted by the Senate on Christmas Eve. But leadership aides in both chambers say there are no plans for a...

docs.lead_paragraph: House Democratic leaders will meet on Tuesday to begin discussing plans to merge their version of major health care legislation with the bill adopted by the Senate on Christmas Eve. But leadership aides in both chambers say there are no plans for a formal conference committee to reconcile the two measures.

headline.main: Democrats Likely to Dispense With Conference Committee

docs.abstract: Democratic leaders in Congress plan to merge the House and Senate health care bills without a formal conference committee, aides said.
docs.snippet: Democratic leaders in Congress plan to merge the House and Senate health care bills without a formal conference committee, aides said.

docs.lead_paragraph: According to a report from a television station in Georgia, President Barack Obama may have been hanged in effigy in the hometown of former President Jimmy Carter on Saturday. Plains, Ga. is best-known as the home of Mr. Carter and the effigy was found hanging above a billboard celebrating the former president on Main Street.

headline.main: Secret Service Investigates Obama Effigy in Carter's Hometown

docs.abstract: President Barack Obama may have been hanged in effigy in the hometown of former President Jimmy Carter on Saturday.
docs.snippet: President Barack Obama may have been hanged in effigy in the hometown of former President Jimmy Carter on Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: A defective heart, a child detained by border guards -- Julia Barquero had already had her struggles. But now her physician at Bellevue Hospital Center, Dr. Danielle Ofri, was trying to explain to Ms. Barquero that she could not receive a heart transplant because she was an illegal immigrant.

headline.main: Treating Patients When Language Is Only One of the Barriers

docs.abstract: In treating immigrant patients, Dr. Danielle Ofri acts as a social worker and counselor as much as she does a doctor.
docs.snippet: In treating immigrant patients, Dr. Danielle Ofri acts as a social worker and counselor as much as she does a doctor.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's time to dust ourselves off and get back on the horse. It is a new year with new opportunities -- and some old problems. I am not an economist, so perhaps I shouldn't make any predictions about the economy.

headline.main: Eight Steps to a Better Year in 2010

docs.abstract: We can't control the economy, but there are some things we can do to adjust to and take advantage of the profound changes affecting the business world.
docs.snippet: We can't control the economy, but there are some things we can do to adjust to and take advantage of the profound changes affecting the business world.

docs.lead_paragraph: Last August, as midnight approached on a Friday, two Treasury Department staff members sat in a cramped basement office in the Treasury Building next to the White House and watched as their e-mail in-boxes filled up. The aides worked for Kenneth Feinberg, the government's special master for executive compensation, and they were awaiting submissions from companies that had received (and not yet paid back) billions in what federal regulations call "exceptional assistance" from the government's Troubled Asset Relief Program, or TARP.

headline.main: What's a Bailed-Out Banker Really Worth?

docs.abstract: How people are paid at the top in a free-market system has always been a contentious issue, especially in bad times, and Kenneth Feinberg's job has put him at the center of a fiery debate.
docs.snippet: How people are paid at the top in a free-market system has always been a contentious issue, especially in bad times, and Kenneth Feinberg's job has put him at the center of a fiery debate.
